alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 02 at 11:29AM PDT until April 03 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 1000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 2500 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory above 1000 feet, snow expected above 1500 feet through this evening then snow expected above 1000 feet through 11 AM PDT Monday morning. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, Eastern Douglas County Foothills above 2500 feet, including higher portions of highway 138 east of Toketee Falls. For the Winter Weather Advisory, areas between 1000 and 2500 feet including Steamboat, Toketee Falls and portions of highway 138. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional low elevation snowfall of 2 to 4 inches is likely on Tuesday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
